page.title: 01Newburgh - Location.
page.content: The town of{Newburgh}lies in the North-East Fife District of{Fife {Region.}It is situated on the south bank of the{River Tay,}about mid-way between{Dundee}and{Perth. The town stretches for about one mile along the river bank between the river and the{Ochil Hills}to the south. The main road from Cupar to Perth forms Newburgh's High Street, with minor roads going off on both sides. The highest point on the hills behind the town is called{Black Cairn {(236m).}The stone from these hills has been quarried for centuries, and one quarry is still operational. A single -track railway line passes through the town. There was a station at one time but it is now closed. The trains which pass through run from Edinburgh to Perth and Inverness.
